name: Shelf hard (temp) - Rocky outcrops and hard bottom shelf (40-200 m depth) - ecosystem component from the WIO Symphony tool
description: This layer was produced by using a seafloor substrate model developed by C Jenkins with regional support from S Fennessy, using the dbSEABED database. Rock and gravel proportion were combined to create a hard bottom proportion. The continental shelf zone was defined by 40-200 meter using GEBCO 2022 data, and yearly average SBT (Sea Bottom Temperature) from Copernicus data was used to model the temperate zone with a linear ramp-up starting at 24 °C (e.g. temp zone = 0) ending at 21.5 °C (e.g. temp zone = 1) Known limitations: Though this data represent best available data, the underlying substrate and bathymetry models are uncertain in most areas of the WIO
license: This work is licensed under a  Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 License
citation: Kågesten G, Jenkins C, Fennessy S, Queste B, WIO Symphony team,  2023, Shelf hard (temp) - ecosystem component from the WIO Symphony tool, https://github.com/WIOSymphony/
